Step 1.title: Step 1: Locate Neck Position
paragraph: Step 1a: Adjust...
If neck is twisted: +1
If neck is side bending: +1

Step 2.title: Step 2: Locate Trunk Position
paragraph: Step 2a: Adjust...
If trunk is twisted: +1
If trunk is side-bending: +1

Step 4.title: Step 4: Look-up Posture Score in Table A
paragraph: Using values from steps 1-3, locate score in Table A

Step 5.title: Step 5: Add Force/Load Score
paragraph: If load < 11 lbs: +0
If load 11 to 22 lbs: +1
If load > 22 lbs: +2
Adjust: if shock or rapid build up of force: add +1

Step 6.title: Step 6: Score A, Find Row in Table C

Scoring.title: Scoring:
paragraph: 1 = negligible risk
2 or 3 = low risk, change may be needed
4 to 7 = medium risk, further investigation, change soon
8 to 10 = high risk, investigate and implement change
11+ = very high risk, implement change

Step 7.title: Step 7: Locate Upper Arm Position:
paragraph: Step 7a: Adjust...
If shoulder is raised: +1
If upper arm is abducted: +1
If arm is supported or person is leaning: -1

Step 9.title: Step 9: Locate Wrist Position:
paragraph: Step 9a: Adjust...
If wrist is bent from midline or twisted : Add +1

Step 10.title: Step 10: Look-up Posture Score in Table B
paragraph: Using values from steps 7-9 above, locate score in Table B

Scoring.title: Scoring
paragraph: Well fitting Handle and mid rang power grip, good: +0
Acceptable but not ideal hand hold or coupling
acceptable with another body part, fair: +1
Hand hold not acceptable but possible, poor: +2
No handles, awkward, unsafe with any body part, Unacceptable: +3

Step 12.title: Step 12: Score B, Find Column in Table C
paragraph: Add values from steps 10 &11 to obtain
Score B. Find column in Table C and match with Score A in
row from Step 6 to obtain Table C Score

Step 13.title: Step 13: Activity Score
paragraph: 1 or more body parts are held for longer than 1 minute (static): +1
Repeated small range actions (more than 4x per minute): +1
Action causes rapid large range changes in postures or unstable base: +1
